intro: Psydrax richardsiae, commonly known as Richards' psidium, is a small evergreen shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
